data.title: Added missed imports.
data.body: Added missed imports in shaders.

data.title: GLSL Error
Added alpha blending option to terrain lightings to allow alpha stencil textures.
data.body: More information [here](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/splatting-textures-with-alpha-using-terrainlighting/38459).

data.title: Fix of the one parameter of shadows render.
data.body: The parameter renderBackFacesShadows is true by default, but it doesn't have effects because the logic of making changes is inside in the setter of this parameter. So I have added a call of the setter during initialization.

data.title: added synchronizing during freeing memory from a deallocator.
data.body: I have found a new issue with the LWJGL buffer allocator in the case with high concurrency because I have added synchronize block only to there, but it needs to be in the deallocator as well.

data.title: Update LWJGL from 3.0.0 to 3.1.0(3.1.2 requires to change …
data.body: Update LWJGL from 3.0.0 to 3.1.0(3.1.2 requires to change code), because starting from the version they use other dependencies for native libraries.

data.title: Camera Spinning with Gamepad
data.body: I'm adding in gamepad and joystick support for my game, but the camera is just spinning. I can still kind of move the camera, however, it's difficult. The player is also constantly making minute movements on the map. Does anyone know how to fix this?

data.title: added support multi-threading allocations for LWJGL Buffer Allocator.
data.body: I see java crashes from time to time with jemalloc when I have high concurrency with memory allocations, so I have added thread-safe implementation of the allocator by default, but if your application doesn't have high concurrency, you can disable thread-safe allocator using a system property to improve performance with it.

data.title: Fix typo on LightPosition and LightDirection
data.body: Fix typo on LightPosition and LightDirection

data.title: AwtKeyInput Missing Keycodes for "PrintScreen"
data.body:
Hey Guys,
As the SDK received an issue request that taking a screenshot while the SceneComposer is open leads to `unsupported key:154` being shown.

After some research, I found out that https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/master/jme3-desktop/src/main/java/com/jme3/input/awt/AwtKeyInput.java#L375 or rather https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/master/jme3-desktop/src/main/java/com/jme3/input/awt/AwtKeyInput.java#L605 is responsible for that.

So if jme has a Key related to PrintScreen or if there are plans on allowing PrintScreen as a key tell me, so I can work on it.

data.title: Resolving issue in ticket #661.  Creating skelton debugger that allow…
data.body: …s bones to be extended in any direction instead of only the Y direction.

data.title: Added missed gl versions
data.body: I think we need to have a possibility to set core profile of most GL version, not only 3.2. Some drivers work correctly only in the case when you use a core profile, but when we use a core profile, we have limits to use features from higher versions. For example Intel Graphics on Linux, which can't use features from 3+ Open GL without a core profile. At this moment, we can use only core profile for the version 3.2, it isn't enough for example if you want to use geometry/tesselation shaders.

data.body: Here's the fix I came up with for issue #357. See my discussion in the forum and on that issue.

data.body:
Refactored Cylinder generation to be more maintainable, readable, and fix #640.
I tested it against the former implementation, and got same results with all parameters.

data.title: Backport changes from the master branch.
data.body: It's just a backport changes from the master branch.

data.title: Fixed #652
data.body:
The issue was due to the texture blending with the object material. By default the material is gray (hence, a gray border). If the material color in blender is set to another color this is being the artifact's color. It can bee seen where the alpha in the texture isn't totally 0 or 1.
The current implementation weren't taking in account the material transparency when blending, so the fix is basically to use it just like blender does.

https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/multiple-blender-importer-changes-fixes/38568

data.title: Fix #646
data.body:
Ignoring the alpha influencer (mapping) if the color one was found first.

https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/multiple-blender-importer-changes-fixes/38568

data.title: Fixed #642
data.body:
It was overriding the userDefinedUVCoords each time any one of them was used, so if different textures were depending on it, a new texCoord buffer was being created.

https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/multiple-blender-importer-changes-fixes/38568

data.title: Fixed a IndexOutOfBoundsException when residual weights are present
data.body: https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/multiple-blender-importer-changes-fixes/38568

data.title: [Feature request] JavaFx Support for jMonkeyEngine
data.body:
jMonkeyEngine already has support to render to a swing window via the JmeCanvasContext. It, however, has no such support for JavaFx. I would like to request that this support be added.

This feature would allow for tools to be made that work with JME using a modern GUI framework, thus improving the quality of JME significantly. 

There are several ways I can see this being done from a technical standpoint:
 - Render to a borderless Swing or LWJGL window and move that window around to match a javafx component while always on top. I tried implementing this, and it works but is also _very_ buggy.
 - (https://github.com/empirephoenix/JME3-JFX)[This]. I tried to get this api working, but the documention is incredibly poor and the project also appears inactive.
 - (https://github.com/SgtRumbi/LWJGLJavaFX)[This]. Since this seems to allow the opengl rendering from JME to be inserted directly into JavaFx's rendering, I think this is the best option. It avoids the buggyness of a swing window overlay, and should be more efficient that JME3-JFX's method of shuffling images around.

data.title: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in LinuxDisplay.java
data.body:
Building the BasicGame template project fails with:

```
SEVERE: Uncaught exception thrown in Thread[jME3 Main,5,main]
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
	at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglDisplay.createContext(LwjglDisplay.java:112)
	at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.initInThread(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:113)
	at com.jme3.system.lwjgl.LwjglAbstractDisplay.run(LwjglAbstractDisplay.java:211)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.getAvailableDisplayModes(LinuxDisplay.java:951)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.init(LinuxDisplay.java:738)
	at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:138)
	... 4 more
```

data.title: Mesh point doc fix
data.body: Reflecting the updated Mesh.setPointSize() documentation in other parts of the class.

data.title: Fixed IllegalArgumentException when removing a LodControl from a spatial
data.body: LodControl throws an exception when the spatial being added to isn't a geometry, however, when the controls is removed it calls setSpatial with a null value triggering the exception throw. Now checking for this null value case.

data.title: Make TempVars Closeable
data.body: Since the original author of issue #621 did not response, here is my merge request to make TempVars closeable.
